chunk: championship is over and it was a great experience didn't go quite how I had hoped I made a few big numbers I also
made a bunch of birdies had a whole bunch of really good shots as many of you know if you followed along there
were a couple of sevens I made on par 5s and an eight I made on a par for the derail week now what can I learn from
this experience well first of all I didn't have a very good game plan for a few scenarios there was a couple short shots like this where you're on Bermuda
grass into the green with a nice upslope and then a downslope on the other side and I didn't really have a good way to
play it and they put the pins where your bailout would leave you that exact shot and twice on par fives I was left with
an eagle pitch from a situation like this and walked off the green with seven which should never happen I gave away
three shots on each of those holes if I had had a better strategy I should have been able to figure out how to get this up-and-down but I didn't what i what
wound up happening is taking my 60-degree wedge and trying to hit a normal little pitch into the green and getting hung up and having the ball roll
back down to me so experience there could have been beneficial it's not another situation I have I run into
every day at home and then on the 18th hole we had a little bit more wind behind us than I had anticipated and I
decided to hit 3-wood off the tee because in the practice round I hit driver and I didn't go through the fairway it's a hole that goes out and
then doglegs hard to the right at about 300 yards well I hit 3-wood and the wind helped me and blew it through the fairway up against the tree and I tried to hit a left handed shot and I wound up
sinking that left handed shot out of bounds so I wanted up taking an 8 on that hole and that was a difference maker if I
just make par there I make the cut and I'm in contention and if I figure out a way to make par or better on those par fives I'm near the top of the
leaderboard just through two days I was in third as far as birdies made so I had made almost as many birdies as anybody
but I just made too many big mistakes so I'll take as a learning experience I'll make sure that next time I'm a little bit better prepared maybe I'll show up a
day or two earlier and learn how to hit some of these shots so that I have a better plan you you
